cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
# [TEMP CHECK] Deploy Aave v3 on Sonic

## Author: ACI

## Date: 2024-12-18

## Simple Summary:

This Temp Check seeks the community’s input on the deployment of Aave V3 on Sonic Mainnet.

## Background:

Sonic is a new Layer 1 EVM blockchain offering 10,000 TPS and fee monetization for app builders. It is the newest blockchain from the creators of Fantom which reached a peak TVL of circa $14.5 billion in 2021. 

## Motivation

Aave has deployed on multiple promising new L1 and L2 EVM networks and is often one of the largest protocols on these networks. Given the impressive history of the team building Sonic, and the innovations it promises, it represents a strong candidate for deployment of Aave V3. In addition, the fee monetization for apps has potential to be an additional income source for Aave.

## Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:

The Sonic Foundation will provide the following, upon its deployment is confirmed:

- 15M USD Funding from Sonic
- 2M migration incentives with 1.8M (of 15M funding) from Sonic + 0.8M from Aave
- Up to 50M $S tokens Supply
- 20M of USDC Supply

More details will be shared on ARFC stage.

## Specification:

Risk Parameters will be provided by Service Providers and this section will be updated at ARFC stage if proposal moves forward, after successful TEMP CHECK Snapshot.

## Disclaimer:

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The ACI is not directly affiliated with Sonic and did not receive any compensation for creating this proposal. 

## Next Steps

1. If consensus is reached on this [TEMP CHECK], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, this proposal will be escalated to ARFC stage.
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

## Copyright:

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

raw.body:
[ARFC] Onboard ezETH to Arbitrum and Base Instances
Author: ACI
Date: 2024-10-29
Summary
This is an ARFC to gauge community sentiment for adding borrow/lend support for Renzo Protocol and its Liquid Restaking Token (LRT) ezETH on AAVE V3 Base and Arbitrum.

Motivation
As productive assets, staking tokens are high quality collateral to borrow against. ezETH is one of the largest liquid restaking tokens. With strong demand for ezETH on mainnet this proposal seeks to provide the opportunity for Aave users to make use of ezETH on leading Layer 2 networks: Base and Arbitrum.

The onboarding of ezETH on these L2s will create increased ezETH demand and increased revenues for both Aave and Renzo Protocol, whilst also bolstering the liquidity and peg stability of ezETH.

Chain to be deployed/listed
Aave v3 instances on Base and Arbitrum.

Proof of Liquidity and Deposit Commitments
ezETH deposits and wstETH borrows will be incentivized with Renzo Points.

Specification
ezETH contracts:

Arbitrum: 0x2416092f143378750bb29b79eD961ab195CcEea5

Base: 0x2416092f143378750bb29b79ed961ab195cceea5

These will be provided by risk service providers and this ARFC updated with parameters accordingly.

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)

## Date: 2024-11-05

---
> Risk Parameters have been updated accordingly with Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-11-26


### **Simple Summary:**

The current ARFC aims to onboard SCR, the native token of Scroll, on the Aave V3 Scroll Instance. This onboarding will allow Aave users to supply and borrow SCR, thereby enhancing the utility and liquidity of the Scroll token within the DeFi ecosystem and more specifically, within the Aave ecosystem.

### **Motivation/Background:**

Scroll is an Ethereum Layer 2 chain which already has an Aave instance deployment and SCR is the governance token for the Scroll L2. By onboarding SCR to Aave V3, we aim to create new opportunities for Aave users to engage with this emerging staking ecosystem, while expanding SCR’s liquidity.

**Benefits of listing this token:**

Provide opportunities for Aave users to borrow against their SCR to unlock liquidity, or alternatively to borrow SCR against other collateral allowing them to participate in Scroll governance.

**Market Impact:**

We see no significant market impact from onboarding SCR except for providing new opportunities to Aave users which may cause users to switch from borrowing other tokens against their collateral. Overall we see onboarding SCR as net good for Aave users as it expands opportunities for them to engage in a new L2 ecosystem.

**Chain to be deployed/listed:**

Scroll.

**Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:**

POL and Deposit Commitments will be discussed at the ARFC stage. 

As disclosed by Marc Zeller, founder of ACI, the ACI Multisig has received 510K SCR on behalf of Aave DAO. Those funds will be coordinated with Karpatkey and Tokenlogic to define best usage of this airdrop. 

### **Specification**

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers on 2024-11-25

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Network | Scroll |
| Isolation Mode | N/A |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | No |
| Supply Cap | 360,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 180,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - |
| LTV | - |
| LT | - |
| Liquidation Bonus | - |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | - |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.0% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 20.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flashloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No |
| E-Mode Category | N/A |

### **Useful Links:**

- [Scroll website](https://scroll.io/)
- [Scroll docs](https://docs.scroll.io/en/home/)
- [[TEMP CHECK]Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-scr-to-aave-v3-scroll-instance/19568)
- [[TEMP CHECK Snapshot] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x900027a0dc30946b463ce8e57a8901b5fc1158546b4d00acae4d2d823d8de732)

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with Scroll and did not receive compensation for creation of this proposal.

ACI and ACI employees may be holders of SCR.

### **Next Steps:**

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.body:
## [ARFC] Onboard slisBNB to Aave V3 on BNB Chain
## Author: ACI
## Date: 2024-07-25
---
Risk Parameters have been updated after Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-07-29

### Summary
This proposal seeks to onboard slisBNB, a tokenized version of staked BNB introduced by Lista DAO, to Aave V3 on the BNB Chain.

### **Motivation**

slisBNB is a Liquid Staking Token (LST) from ListaDAO, which aims to bring additional liquidity and utility to staked BNB. The token allows users to participate in the staking rewards while maintaining the flexibility to use their staked assets within the DeFi ecosystem.

Onboarding slisBNB will allow Aave users to utilize it as collateral, thus broadening the asset base and enhancing overall liquidity.

### Proof of Liquidity and Deposit Commitments

Users who supply slisBNB liquidity on Aave, will be eligible to get stardust (points) from Lista's ongoing point system Cosmic Adventure Challenge Season 3, which will turn to LISTA token airdrop when Season 3 ends.

### Specification

Token Name: slisBNB

Underlying Asset: Staked BNB

Contract: 0xB0b84D294e0C75A6abe60171b70edEb2EFd14A1B

> Risk Parameters and analysis have been provided by Risk Service Providers so ARFC has been be updated accordingly.

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|Isolation Mode|No|
|Borrowable|Yes|
|Borrowable in Isolation|No|
|Collateral Enabled|Yes|
|E-Mode Category|None|
|Supply Cap|20,000|
|Borrow Cap|2,000|
|Debt Ceiling|-|
|LTV|55%|
|LT|60%|
|Liquidation Bonus|7.50%|
|Liquidation Protocol Fee|10.00%|
|Variable Base|0.0%|
|Variable Slope1|7.00%|
|Variable Slope2|300.00%|
|Uoptimal|45.00%|
|Reserve Factor|15.00%|
|Stable Borrowing|Disabled|
|Flashloanable|Yes|
|Siloed Borrowing|No|


### **Useful Links:**

https://lista.org/

https://lista.org/liquid-staking/BNB

### Disclaimer:

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with Lista DAO and did not receive compensation for creating this proposal.

### Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright:

---

Title: [ARFC] Onboard BNBx to Aave V3 BNB Chain
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-05-27

---

### **Summary**
This ARFC proposes the addition of BNBx from Stader to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

BNBx is a liquid staked token of BNB from Stader. Users can freely mint BNBx in exchange for BNB deposits and earn yield from staking.

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract address: [0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275](https://bscscan.com/token/0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275)

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | No |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (BNBx) | 5,000 |
| Borrow Cap (BNBx) | 500 |
| Debt Ceiling | NA |
| LTV | 65.00% |
| LT | 70.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 7.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 15.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flahloanable  | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No |

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC has been updated.

## **Useful Links**

- Website: https://www.staderlabs.com/
- BNBx docs: https://binance.docs.staderlabs.com/
- [TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-bnbx-on-aave-v3-bnb-chain/16850)
- [TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x9510ea1d3c9fd0f1fd67b05860ca2f1dafb65b983ff1f81d962b7dea0c47b13b)

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

decision.summary: This proposal seeks community approval to deploy Aave V3 on the Sonic blockchain, a new high-throughput EVM-compatible Layer 1 network developed by the creators of Fantom. The deployment includes onboarding WETH, wS, and USDC.e with conservative risk parameters due to the nascent liquidity environment on Sonic. The proposal has robust early and stable support in voting and forum discussions, despite some concerns about conservative Loan-to-Value parameters.
key_arguments_for: Sonic's network is highly scalable with 10,000 TPS and offers fee monetization to app developers, presenting an opportunity for additional income.
The team behind Sonic has a strong track record, having developed Fantom which achieved significant TVL historically.
Sonic ecosystem liquidity is growing rapidly with strong incentives and commitment including $15M funding from Sonic Foundation and $20M USDC supply.
Multiple risk assessment providers and community entities such as LlamaRisk and Chaos Labs support the deployment with recommendations for conservative initial parameters and phased supply caps.
Voting timeline metrics show unanimous early and sustained support for the 'YAE' choice with strong vote power backing.
Forum sentiment largely supports deployment, highlighting the strategic value and Sonic’s rapid TVL growth.
key_arguments_against: Sonic network is still new with limited liquidity, which constrains growth and may increase risk of bad debt due to liquidators' inefficiency.

Concerns raised in the forum about conservative Loan-to-Value ratios, especially for the native S token, which may reduce borrower attractiveness and platform utilization compared to competitors like Silo.
Limited decentralization risks remain due to only one node client and lack of detailed upgrade/change management processes.
Some forum members express frustration about governance process delays and conservative risk parameters, suggesting these could hinder competitive positioning.

evidence.quote: Forum comments show strong expert support from LlamaRisk, Chaos Labs, and community endorsements citing Sonic's rapid TVL growth and strategic opportunity. Some critical voices highlight the need for revising LTV parameters and governance delays.
Voting timeline reveals unanimous and stable lead for 'YAE' option with a lead ratio of 1.0 across all quartiles and high stability metrics, indicating strong consensus and early engagement.

evidence.reference: Similar past proposals on Aave deployments
evidence.quote: Prior similar proposals to deploy on emerging chains with conservative parameters passed with strong support but saw post-vote declines in token price and TVL, suggesting risks with new chain deployments.

decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• The voting timeline analysis shows unanimous, early, and sustained support for the 'YAE' option, indicating strong consensus among voters.
• Forum sentiment analysis reveals majority support with expert endorsements highlighting Sonic's scalability, growing TVL, and strategic value for Aave expansion, despite some concerns over conservative risk parameters.
• Historical lessons from similar past proposals indicate that while new chain deployments carry risks reflected in post-vote TVL and price declines, the current proposal includes robust risk management and community backing to mitigate these.
• Market impacts reflect moderate declines but do not outweigh the long-term strategic benefit of expansion to a promising new chain.
• Overall, the recommendation to 'Change' by deploying Aave V3 on Sonic aligns with the aggregated voting sentiment and expert forum support, promoting the organization's durable benefit.
